title: [K-12] Health Literacy and Behavior Change Competency Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science knowledge and foundational understanding of health concepts
context.additional_context: A personalized health education curriculum based on adult learning theory and cognitive psychology, emphasizing learner-led participation and actionable behavior change strategies for real-life application

learning_goals: Learners can select reliable health information by applying health information evaluation and critical thinking skills.
Learners can convert health-related knowledge into long-term memory using cognitive psychology-based learning strategies.
Learners can maintain healthy lifestyle habits (e.g., diet management, physical activity) for over eight weeks through self-directed goal-setting and monitoring skills.
Learners can improve questioning and decision-making abilities by acquiring effective communication skills with healthcare professionals.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
